title: LLM predictions for 2026, shared with Oxide and Friends
description: Simon Willison shares his predictions for AI coding in 2026: 1 year predictions include that LLMs writing good code will become undeniable, sandboxing will be solved, and a 'Challenger disaster' for coding agent security will occur. 3 year predictions include that someone will build a new browser using mainly AI-assisted coding and it won't be surprising. 6 year prediction: typing code by hand will go the way of punch cards. Willison notes that Claude Opus 4.5 and GPT-5.2 have reduced his hand-written code to single digit percentages.
author: Simon Willison

title: My LLM coding workflow going into 2026
description: Addy Osmani shares his comprehensive LLM coding workflow for 2026, emphasizing 'AI-augmented software engineering' rather than full automation. Key insights: ~90% of code for Claude Code is written by Claude Code itself. Workflow includes: 1) Start with clear specs before coding, 2) Break work into small iterative chunks, 3) Provide extensive context and guidance, 4) Choose the right model for each task, 5) Keep human in the loop with testing and reviews, 6) Commit often and use version control as safety net, 7) Customize AI behavior with rules and examples. Emphasizes that all software engineering fundamentals become even more important with AI.
author: Addy Osmani

title: Best Coding LLMs January 2026 Rankings
description: WhatLLM.org publishes comprehensive rankings of AI models for coding including GPT-5.2, Claude Opus 4.5, Gemini 3, and DeepSeek. The rankings compare performance on code generation, debugging, and software development tasks.
author: WhatLLM.org

title: Best AI Coding Tools for Developers in 2026
description: Builder.io publishes overview of AI coding tools for 2026, covering how LLMs crawl, quote, and summarize documentation in tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and Cursor. Discusses AI workflows developers rely on and tools that scale from solo workflows to teams.
author: Builder.io

title: Replit Launches No-Code AI Tool for iOS Apps
description: Replit launches a new AI Agent that can turn ideas into App Store-ready apps without writing code. The tool uses natural language processing to create iOS applications, announced on January 15, 2026. CEO Amjad Masad emphasizes that users can now create applications faster than searching for solutions online.
author: Replit / Amjad Masad
